positive.review: Awesome game. Its short but it has a great story and cool puzzles. Recommend

You start Inside just vibing, and five minutes later you‚Äôre questioning the meaning of life while holding your breath in a swamp. The atmosphere is thicker than anxiety at a family reunion. The animations are smoother than butter sliding down silk.

No dialogue. No HUD. Just pure emotional damage wrapped in artistic perfection. Every sound, every shadow, every awkwardly-timed jump feels like it‚Äôs whispering ancient secrets straight into your spine.

By the time I reached the ending, I wasn‚Äôt sure if I‚Äôd beaten the game or if the game had psychologically adopted me. I closed it, stared into the void for ten minutes, and honestly? The void blinked first.

Pros:

Existential dread (in 4K)

Puzzles that make you feel both dumb and enlightened

Ending will haunt your dreams

Little boy runs like his life depends on it (because it does)

Cons:

None. My only complaint is that I can‚Äôt play it for the first time again.

Final Verdict:
Playdead didn‚Äôt just make a game. They made an experience.
10/10 ‚Äî ‚ÄúInside‚Äù? More like Incredible.

Inside is a dark and spooky 2D platformer that focuses on puzzles. This game looks great; it has a mysterious vibe to it. There is no combat in the game, just puzzles. The story of  Inside is dark and does not tell you a lot; it shows you a lot. If you like games with a dark setting  that are unsettling and mysterious, try this game!

Holy moly, they've done it again. Limbo had a somewhat abstract art style, but Inside leans into realism, and it pays off handsomely. The animation, and especially the sound, is exquisite, every little detail is accounted for. As for the gameplay, it's just like Limbo: your controller has two buttons, and you're controlling a young boy, so there's not many variables to contend with, meaning the puzzles are generally not too hard. It took me a little longer to beat than Limbo, but don't let its relatively short length put you off. It's a mesmerising experience - just make sure to turn the lights down and turn your headphones up.

An intriguing dystopian experience through the lens of an unfortunate youth, INSIDE provides a short yet enthralling puzzle game that keeps the player gripped with varying levels & seamless transitions between points of interest.  It tackles themes of mind control, authoritarian regimes, & science fiction elements.  I am eagerly waiting for the developer's next release.

artsy fartsy game my beloved. 

"we decided to go with a minimalist style because we ran out of money." ahh devs 

jokes aside, if you're into limbo, play this game. it's good for what it is and the atmosphere is fantastic.
Damn! I think it's one of the most atmospheric games that I ever played. I have more questions than answers, I was intrigued the whole time.
A quite disturbing but fun puzzle game, also easy achievements.

Dark, Sinister, Weird, Sublime.

A short (4 hours?), but amazing game. It kinda feels like the darker cousin of Gris, with the same kinds of storytelling and platforming, but with a much more sinister theme.

The opening and ending sequences in particular are really fantastic. The subject matter is grim, but the player experience is top notch.

My only minor gripes are that the water sections in the middle can get a bit samey, and there is a little bit too much of a "die till you get it" way of exploring.

Overall, a really excellent game that's well worth playing.
such a good short game that I wish it never finished. unique and smart puzzles. this game is just different

Very interesting story, mechanics & physics are great, and really enjoy the art-style. and the overall dark tone.

10/10 from me
That was fun. Also kind of disturbing, especially the dogs scenes. And also the fact I finished it for 5 hours when the game is 2 hours long. But I really enjoyed it, especially the ending!

i recommend playing this game. from the eerie music, to the disturbing post-apocalyptic-themed background, this game pulls you along with its mysterious story. why does the child keep going further and further into danger, who knows? the controls felt intuitive and interacting with objects was more or less easy. the puzzles felt like a bonus to the story as they were not complex to the point where you have to think hard about what needs to be done. overall inside delivers on exactly what it is trying to accomplish and can be completed in one sitting with no issues. the achievements are really there for you to explore the world. inside does seem to go on 90% discounts pretty frequently on steam so i would recommend waiting to buy this game for $1.99 rather than it's default $19.99 cost as i don't really think it's worth spending $20 for.

This game totally took me by surprise. It was recommended to me by a friend so I got it and started playing. Right off the bat I was hit with unexpected surprises. One after another too. Then the deeper I got into the game it just got weirder and weirder, in a good way. I can honestly say, I've never played a game like this before and I was both pleasantly surprised and disturbed.

A nice short adventure! I got this game bundled with Limbo and they are pretty similar both story wise and mechanics wise (although this one feels more complete). My only complaint is the same as with Limbo, the story isn't clearly stated and is left hanging by lore items and easter eggs. Other than that, I would definetly recommend this game.

One of the best games I've ever played, i would've never guessed that this game was so beautifully made, from the visuals to the incredible audio.. 
Would definitely recommend this game to anyone and also hoping for the release of the 3D game they are hopefully working on.
This game is art. One of the finest examples of visual storytelling in gaming. There's a lot to interpret and study here. It's a very simple game mechanically, but a very deep experience.

Inside is a masterclass in atmospheric, minimalist game design. Right from the first steps through its rain-soaked woods, it drags you into a bleak, wordless world where every shadow feels significant and every sound is loaded with tension. Rather than pounding you with exposition or tutorial pop-ups, the game trusts you to unearth its secrets and figure things out through movement, experimentation, and sheer intuition.

You play as a nameless boy, running for his life across hauntingly rendered environments that echo both dystopian horror and strange beauty. The sense of dread is unmatched‚Äîas you crawl through mud, hide from faceless adults, or plunge through icy water, the silence is broken only by subtle, perfectly placed audio cues that make the hairs on your neck stand up. Even with no dialogue and no HUD, Inside communicates everything purely through sound, visuals, and the sheer desperation of your character‚Äôs sprint.

Puzzles are at the core of the experience: never overwhelming, but always clever. They ramp up in complexity but rarely obstruct your path for so long that the tension fades. Some trial and error is required, and a few sections (especially around water) can feel a bit repetitive, but the game always finds its rhythm again. The platforming is tight and responsive, and every animation feels meticulously crafted. It‚Äôs not a long game‚Äîmost players will finish in around three to four hours‚Äîbut every minute is densely packed with intrigue and uneasy wonder.

Replay value is mostly found in hunting for hidden secrets and seeing a bizarre alternate ending, but Inside‚Äôs main journey is so tightly constructed that its short length never feels like a drawback. If anything, the brevity makes its moments hit even harder. It‚Äôs disturbing, mysterious, and gripping without ever feeling over-the-top or exploitative.

If you appreciated the strange, silent horror of Limbo, Inside takes everything to the next level: richer visuals, deeper atmosphere, and an ending that will either haunt or puzzle you for days afterward. For fans of moody puzzle-platformers or anyone seeking a genuinely unique experience, it‚Äôs an easy recommendation. Turn off the lights, put on headphones, and let yourself get pulled inside.

Quick and easy fun, took me around 3 hours to complete the story, its abit strange that their isnt any dialogue but you just kinda come up with your own conclusions to what the story means which is cool and different.

Overall i think it should be free, thats really the only negative thing i have to say, other then that its a great little horror game.

Is Sonic really innovative anymore? I'm getting a bit bored of collecting rings, quite frankly. Sonic has always been fun to control, but the aesthetic is growing very tiresome. Dr Egg man desperately needs rebalancing too; as the final boss, I expected far more polish. Shadow is a far superior boss battle - the player having to actually use timing and quick-reaction based tactics, in order to beat him.

You see how I started this by reviewing a fictional Sonic game? Weird, eh? That's how confused I was when starting out in this game. If you got someone to play it without telling them it's got a significant horror element to it, I think you'll get some hilarious results. It very quickly goes from confusing, to sh*t-your-pants terrifying! Then back to being a bit confused again, but that's a good thing, as you're trying and figure out the puzzles to progress this time. I'm being a bit stupid, but honestly, this game is a work of art. The art style is absolutely gorgeous and unique; it's extremely both relaxing, and unsettling somehow. The ending is an absolute mind-melter. A real experience of a game. If the aesthetic even remotely appeals to you, just buy it. It's an absolute horrific pleasure to endure.

- Also, Tails is an annoying b*tch.

Insane game.... jaw dropping out of this world game, the movement of the keystrokes compared to movement of the player is some of the best movements in gaming I have ever experienced. Recommend for sure!
A wonderfully short experience that left me wishing it would go on forever. The puzzles are clever and refreshingly unique, making the whole game feel truly one-of-a-kind.
Nice game, especially for relaxing brain. Don't see walkthroughs if you actually want to enjoy the game

INSIDE by Playdead is one of those games that even a lot of AAA titles with multi million dollar budgets don't live up to. There are AAA masterpieces of course, but there are a lot of AAA games that just rinse and repeat the bare minimum and churn out the same product to barely satisfy their player base, half baked, half finished, downgraded from what was promised, riddled with bugs at launch etc. INSIDE is an Indie game made by the studio that gave us LIMBO (another must play). The game is a masterclass in art design, sound design, cryptic story telling, puzzle design. It is a short 2 to 3 hour game, but will leave you more satisfied than a lot of 30-40 hour long AAA titles out there. The story gives you just enough for you to play the game and complete your journey but the overall lore and story of the world is left to you to decode and put together piece by piece. It is a definite must play and I am very excited to play whatever this team cooks next.

Pretty cool game, if you like puzzle games within a 2D movement restriction, akin to Little Nightmares, you should try it.

Make no mistake, Inside is a 'Show Don't Tell' PUZZLE game, with a horror/eerie atmosphere with some slight moments making me jolt.
The sound, and environment design is very good, making the game in a low-poly artstyle while enhancing the smaller details easily made me feel immersed without knowing anything about the world, learning as the game progressed.

Needless to say, the game is very good, and if you are a Little Nightmares fan and like sudden lore revealed through hints and actions, you should try the game.
nice game, but is a little short, and the final is enough odd.
Made my GF who never plays games play this. She got a hand of the controls pretty easily. She screamed so much from the dogs. She wants to play Limbo now. 10/10
For such a simple game it is highly amusing. I‚Äôm only halfway through but next to Ghost of Yotei, this is the best game I‚Äôve played in 2025!!!

Playdead studios really understood what worked in Limbo and expanded their ideas into making this journey even more mysterious, haunting, and just morbidly fascinating all around. 

While I have grown to really enjoy their last game, the puzzles, visual storytelling, and experience makes this one a must play, as it's a lot more satisfying overall. Without spoiling, the finale is both disturbing yet highly memorable!

The game is moderately short; clocking in about 3-5 hours even when going for the hidden secrets. The trial and error gameplay is still here, and there's almost no replay value once you finish the game. If Limbo didn't pull you in, you may not like this one either, but I do believe this is the better game and also worth experiencing once!
If you enjoyed Little Nightmares, you'll likely also enjoy Inside, Only took about 7 hours to play through, but it was a good experience and the story presented some very interesting ideas.
Just lay back and play it with a controller and enjoy the environmental story telling.
amazing puzzle game with really eerie atmosphere. fairly short(for me it was 5 hours) but still extremely memorable, but maybe wait for a discount before buying.

Excelente experi√™ncia. Sem firulas desnecess√°rias.
A jogabilidade √© simples e eficaz: um bot√£o para pular e outro para a√ß√µes pontuais, como empurrar objetos ou ativar alavancas. O clima sombrio √© bem constru√≠do e mant√©m o jogador curioso sobre os pr√≥ximos acontecimentos ‚Äî o que, por si s√≥, j√° cumpre o papel de entreter.
A trilha sonora √© √≥tima, n√£o no sentido de ser algo que voc√™ vai querer ouvir fora do jogo, mas sim por ser perfeitamente encaixada nos momentos certos, refor√ßando a ambienta√ß√£o.
O final pode n√£o agradar a todos, mas no geral, gostei bastante da experi√™ncia


Excellent experience. No unnecessary frills.
The gameplay is simple and effective: one button to jump and another for occasional actions like pushing objects or activating levers. The eerie atmosphere is well-crafted and keeps you intrigued about what‚Äôs going to happen next ‚Äî which, in itself, fulfills the game‚Äôs purpose of entertaining.
The soundtrack is great ‚Äî not something you‚Äôd necessarily want to download and listen to on its own, but it‚Äôs perfectly timed and enhances the game‚Äôs mood.
The ending might not please everyone, but overall, I really enjoyed the game.

The ending.... wow.   I sat there staring at the screen for a moment, completely baffled, just waiting. Then I started wondering if i somehow missed something.  And when it finally sank in that no, that really was the end...I was at a loss.

  There were plenty of scenes I genuinely enjoyed,  and the experience as a whole is unique for sure.  So for that reason, I'd RELUCTANTLY recommend this game.

Inside is an all around improvement of the previous game Limbo.  There is less trial and error and the puzzles have been streamlined.  The music and artstyle is unique and there is a lot of variety throughout the game.  I recommend you pick this one up, especially over that bonkers of an ending.
First played this back in 2016, and have played it too many times to count by now. One of my favourite games of all time. Wish I could go back and experience it for the first time again.

Inside is a very Interesting experience. 
Visually it is stunning and the sound is used perfectly to underline the emotions and world around you. The gameplay is fun, the puzzles are explained to you by the enviroment very effectively. 
I did like the story but i do have some conflicting feelings.
Despite that i recommend playing it, as it was fun.

After 30 hours in INSIDE, I can confidently say it‚Äôs one of the most unique and intense games I‚Äôve played. The story is deep and mysterious, and the atmosphere is out of this world. The puzzles are cleverly designed and keep you on edge without ever feeling lost. The minimalist graphics are stunning, and the effects really enhance the sense of isolation and hopelessness. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for something innovative, unexpected, and truly immersive. Every minute is worth it!

Breathtaking. Literally. All the tension and bittersweet story. It too reminded me of AKIRA. Perhaps inspired in a way. Discount right now is very generous, but full price is deserving as well. I get it why overwhelmingly positive. I don't finish all the achievement, seems difficult but perhaps you're down for it. EDIT: Complete achievement! It will change your perception of the game as whole!

Inside is the perfected embodiment of the idea conceived in Limbo and in my opinion it is the best cinematic platformer ever created. Quietly terrifying, unparalleled in its craftsmanship and design. Intriguing meta level ideas take root deep within. Deep in your mind. That's "Inside".

graphics are beautiful. 
puzzles are easy but satisfying.
story is intriguing.
ending is terrible.

INSIDE is an exceptionally compelling experience. This game is a masterclass in minimalist design and environmental storytelling, following the standard set by its predecessor, Limbo. The physics-based platforming and intuitive puzzles are executed flawlessly, creating a tight and satisfying gameplay loop. However, the true strength lies in its chilling, enigmatic atmosphere and its haunting, wordless narrative that delivers a powerful punch. It is a visually arresting and unforgettable short adventure that is highly recommended.
Very bleak desolate and atmospheric game. Its maybe a bit short but still absolutely worth picking up and playing.

I really love this game, not too short neither too long, enjoyable, the scenes, the music, the story, everything was awesome!! although took me around 5 hours to complete it, there's still some badges to obtain and others path to take.

Jeez.. such a good game. In terms of replayability id give it a 6/10. Mainly because the length of some puzzles are long enough to bore you with repeating them but the fact that there are two endings that you can work towards to is satisfying enough. Solid 10/10 game-play, lighting and music. Loved the theories surrounding how this game and Limbo are connected.

this game is interesting and filled with mysteries you dont understand anything untill very end i didnt get the philosofical thought behind this game so i had to watch it on youtube itys so cool i totally recomend this game if you liked "little nightmares"

Favorite horror game, period. Just... unbelievably fucking phenomenal. So many moments that just leave you utterly speechless... definitely one of those pieces of art that makes you appreciate the medium itself.

Very very good game, its like they say lets do a better version of limbo, the puzzles are not that hard and when i saw the solution in youtube i was like how didnt i thought that, very recommended, very dark also.

[h1] STRANGELY CINEMATIC [/h1]
*spoiler free review*
this is the only way of describing that game. Since the start, the visual and sounds gets you on the tip of the toes, feeling like you are being observed and followed during an considerable part of the playthrough, and maybe you are, maybe not. The puzzles kinda of brake this atmosphere, but you still have the felling of being at an unconfortable/dangerous place. Although thats the impression you have, the plot twist is still very unexpected.
This is basically an work of art, if u liked limbo this one will be a VERY big "upgrade"
[b] att: snake[/b]

A great game. Took me 3hrs to finish the game.
The game has a great but dark atmosphere to it.

I'd recommend using a mouse and keyboard + use your own key bindings

If anything in the trailer or description looks appealing to you then you will love this game. Even if you normally don't like this genre there is a very good chance you'll still enjoy this game. It's fantastic, and I can fully recommend it for the full price.

Inside is so incredibly made that it makes me with this team had more games. The tone and atmosphere of the game is amazing and the sound design is so good it made me cringe sometimes, I felt it in my brain. It's a short and sweet game that is so so enjoyable to play and is severely underrated.
the music, art, gameplay, 10/10, masterpiece

11 out of 11 bojankles

completely sucks you in this brutalist dystopia for 3 hours and doesn't let go until you're sunbathing. a combined masterpiece of puzzles and sound design. just a shame the two directors who made it couldn't stick together
An incredibly haunting atmosphere, great artstyle, fluid controls and a mysterious narrative. Highly recommended.

Fun game. The atmosphere is so well done. It really pulls you in. The transitions between the different areas of the game and the variety of puzzles is great. Its well done, fun and quick. Really worth the play.

This was very interesting game .. no words have been spoken whole time and yet the atmosphere was incredibly heavy, absolutely loved the dark enviroments & mood in this game

Clever puzzles and both normal and secrets endings were a good food for thinking and interpretation

8/10

PS: Not sure if it was just me but when i was trying to play with Xbox controller connected by bluetooth dongle, game started having insane stuttering and was nearly unplayable, after turning off controller everything was okay and smooth .. very weird but perhaps it will save you time if it happens to you
Amazing platforming and unique but understandable puzzles.

What a trip. What a trip. What a trip! Just got weirder, and weirder. And then, somehow, even weirder.

Such a fun experience.
Very reminiscent of Limbo, - with a little bit of Little Nightmares.
Better version of Limbo with great visual and sound design.
Your mom might repost a clip of this on facebook and say "we live in a society." It's cool but nothing crazy imo.
The lighting and style is very good. Worth playing till the end.
Absolutely stupendous sound design and world building.
incredible ost, puzzle designs, and monster designs, the story is not told but shown, it's for you to find out yourself. 9/10.

10/10 the game where you learn about the free will in this messed up world: [strike]means losing control, following orders or be chaotic, and eventually free but on whose will?..[/strike] look to the sky and glee.. be free.. take yourself out of the system.

P.S. also there's 2 endings: true intended and secret door cornfield.

[h3] A quiet masterpiece [/h3]

For Limbo lovers.

If you hear dogs, [b] RUN [/b] ! Run for your life and do not look back.
Intriguing, dark, and the whole "less is more" leads one to ponder what happened in the boy's world.
The main character proved that if you try hard enough, you can steal a ton of minced meat from a secret laboratory
Absolutely amazing game. This is how this genre should be represented. <3
Amazing game, love to replay it every few years
Vamos l√°, Playdead, cad√™ seu pr√≥ximo jogo?
It is similar to Limbo but it come's with batter visuals.
one of a kind experience truly bizarre and captivating
9 years late to the party, but an amazing game. 10/10.
One of the best games, I have ever Played. The game that really match my vibes üî•
Phenomenal piece of art. A haunting experience. Lovely.
amazing plot and storyline and awesome main ending
Sometimes I still randomly think about this beautifully surreal game.
One of the best games I have ever played. This game is a work of art!
I liked the thriller aspect of this game, it makes my heart pump fast.
A good game to finish in an afternoon or two.
good game but watch out for the dogs
This is really mind blowing...100% recommended.
Best game about a nut sack I've ever played.
Atmospheric amazing puzzles 10/10
This game is great..but what the hell was "that"?
Story and Atmosphere
pretty short game but really nice
Amazing! Absolutely love this game! A true work of art!
Very much like limbo. Great game.
Escape from the inhumane experiment lab. Good puzzles.
it is very easy to do please refund it to me
Short n sweet. Fantastic ending
never knew what to expect but so glad i played this
100% Achievements in 7.2 hours.
nice game   game play are good
nice game puzzle game
best game ive ever played

negative.review: What an incredible game that I have to level a negative on. There's just no story exposition or evolution, and then the shittest ending I've ever seen in a game. Blob stops and nothing. NOTHING. The gall to do nothing.
simulator of running and swimming. as a fan of platformers and puzzle games, this one i dont like.
Playing this game is like dating someone who expects you to read their mind but worse, right cos waiting next to a wall for an angry dog makes sense and it would normally occur to you. OBNOXIOUS

Limbo had an open ended ending with hope. 
Inside has an interesting ride that throws you into the gutter with nothing.

I played INSIDE for about ten hours, really wanting to see what made it so praised, but honestly, it just didn‚Äôt click with me. The atmosphere is amazing ‚Äî dark, mysterious, and beautifully crafted ‚Äî but after a while, it all starts to feel the same. The puzzles are simple and repetitive, and the slow pacing made it hard to stay engaged. The story tries to be deep and symbolic, but it ends up feeling too vague, like it‚Äôs mysterious just for the sake of being mysterious. The visuals and sound design are top-tier, I‚Äôll give it that, but the gameplay itself felt empty and the ending didn‚Äôt feel rewarding enough to make up for the long, slow build-up. It‚Äôs not a bad game at all, just not as special as people make it out to be ‚Äî at least for me.

I am not sure what happened. I was enjoying the game, but it's super hard to understand. I still don't fully understand the story. I don't want to spoil the end. so lets just say: it didn't make sense.
I thought I was going to unveil something at the end of the story that explains why everyone is trying to capture this boy? or what happened to this society? or even what the hell was in the basement that seemed to create shockwaves strong enough to tear someone apart?

If you like game where things are totally left up to your imagination, than maybe this game is for you? But I want answers! I was left not just hungry for more. But starving. My patience died at the end of the game XD

I don't hate the game, or the puzzles. they were fun! just the story, that's half the game for me. :/
its cool but the puzzles can be very unintuitive, which ruins the pacing

What an incredible game that I have to level a negative on. There's just no story exposition or evolution, and then the shittest ending I've ever seen in a game. Blob stops and nothing. NOTHING. The gall to do nothing.

I played INSIDE for about ten hours, really wanting to see what made it so praised, but honestly, it just didn‚Äôt click with me. The atmosphere is amazing ‚Äî dark, mysterious, and beautifully crafted ‚Äî but after a while, it all starts to feel the same. The puzzles are simple and repetitive, and the slow pacing made it hard to stay engaged. The story tries to be deep and symbolic, but it ends up feeling too vague, like it‚Äôs mysterious just for the sake of being mysterious. The visuals and sound design are top-tier, I‚Äôll give it that, but the gameplay itself felt empty and the ending didn‚Äôt feel rewarding enough to make up for the long, slow build-up. It‚Äôs not a bad game at all, just not as special as people make it out to be ‚Äî at least for me.

I am not sure what happened. I was enjoying the game, but it's super hard to understand. I still don't fully understand the story. I don't want to spoil the end. so lets just say: it didn't make sense.
I thought I was going to unveil something at the end of the story that explains why everyone is trying to capture this boy? or what happened to this society? or even what the hell was in the basement that seemed to create shockwaves strong enough to tear someone apart?

If you like game where things are totally left up to your imagination, than maybe this game is for you? But I want answers! I was left not just hungry for more. But starving. My patience died at the end of the game XD

I don't hate the game, or the puzzles. they were fun! just the story, that's half the game for me. :/
its cool but the puzzles can be very unintuitive, which ruins the pacing

What an incredible game that I have to level a negative on. There's just no story exposition or evolution, and then the shittest ending I've ever seen in a game. Blob stops and nothing. NOTHING. The gall to do nothing.
simulator of running and swimming. as a fan of platformers and puzzle games, this one i dont like.

Limbo had an open ended ending with hope. 
Inside has an interesting ride that throws you into the gutter with nothing.
